$description:
| What does this do? | Ensures the Connection filter IP Allow list (Default Hosted Connection Filter Policy) contains no entries so inbound mail is subject to spam filtering and sender authentication checks. |
| Why should you use this? | Prevents bypassing of spam and authentication checks (SPF, DKIM, DMARC) that can occur when IP addresses are allow-listed, reducing the risk of malicious or spoofed messages being delivered to user inboxes and supporting a zero-trust posture. |
| What is the end-user impact? | Minimal for most users; some previously allow-listed senders may be flagged by spam filters and require remediation (for example, updating sender authentication or using approved transport methods). |
| Learn more | [Connection filter policies - Configure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-office-365/connection-filter-policies-configure) |
